The DNS record for webmail is used to redirect web traffic, usually for accessing the webmail interface, and does not affect the SMTP/IMAP/POP3 protocols that manage sending and receiving email.

Email will continue to function through the primary MX record configured to the IP where Postfix is running. Therefore, email will operate independently of where the webmail points.
I am not changing MX record until you migrate all mailboxes - the server is setup - I am configuring a webmail for your users
for now I need https://webmail.evrazia.su/ to work and pointed to our server - can you please configure that?
